byline.contributor: Falih Hassan reported from Baghdad, Sewell Chan from London, and Helene Cooper from Washington.
byline.original: By FALIH HASSAN, SEWELL CHAN and HELENE COOPER

abstract: Iraqi Prime Min Haider al-Abadi flies to western city of Ramadi to celebrate its liberation from Islamic State; trip is seen as sign of resolve as he vows to free Mosul.
lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi flew to the city to celebrate its “liberation” from the Islamic State, as Iraqis thronged the city’s battle-scarred streets.

headline.main: Celebrating Victory Over ISIS, Iraqi Leader Looks to Next Battles
headline.print_headline: Celebrating Victory Over ISIS, Iraqi Leader Looks to Next Battles

snippet: Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi flew to the city to celebrate its “liberation” from the Islamic State, as Iraqis thronged the city’s battle-scarred streets.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
